Customer.title: Customer
Customer.description: Represents a customer in the CustomerLifeline application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Customer entity.

subscriptionTenure.description: The subscription tenure of the customer (e.g., '1 year', '3 years').

status.description: The status of the customer, either 'active' or 'pending'.

statusHistory.description: History of status changes for the customer.

isArchived.description: Indicates if the customer is archived (soft deleted).

reasonForArchival.description: The reason why the customer was archived.

definition.description: Stores customer information. Includes 'status' field to indicate 'active' or 'pending' status, 'statusHistory' to track status changes, and 'isArchived' for soft deletion.

firestore.reasoning: The database structure prioritizes preventing customer deletion as a primary requirement. To support the management of active and pending customers and the transition between these states, a single `customers` collection is used. A `status` field within each customer document indicates whether the customer is 'active' or 'pending', and the `statusHistory` array tracks all state transitions. The `isArchived` field is used for soft deletion. This design ensures a simple and straightforward approach to managing customer data and transitions while adhering to the no-deletion requirement.
